English: to hit the mark, hit upon, succeed, do right
to advise, give notice, give warning, warn
to go through, cross, run through
to heat up, warm, warm up
to have fun, have a good time
to shut in, lock up, close in, confine
to rub, scrub, scour, wash, mop
to manifest, reveal, display, show, declare
to pervert, lead astray, garble, corrupt
to have a feeling, have an idea
to prevent, prepare, make ready, anticipate, foresee, avoid, overcome
to water, irrigate, wash, sprinkle, spray
to deny vigorously, detest, abhor, renegade, apostatize, swear, blaspheme
to fold over & over, fall back, retreat
to require, need, request, ask for, send for, call for
to retain, hold back, keep, catch, hold
to burst, explode, blow up, break
to harvest, reap, mow, cut down
to calm, quiet, appease, soothe, pacify
to extend, spread out, stretch forth
to tempt, feel, examine by touch
